lead_paragraph: The F.B.I. has faulted an agent who shot the tire of a suspect’s S.U.V. during an attempted arrest, but not two other agents who killed the man.

headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Says Killing of Maryland Man Was Justified, but Not Shooting His Tire
headline.main: F.B.I. Says Killing Man Was Justified, but Not Shooting His Tire

snippet: The F.B.I. has faulted an agent who shot the tire of a suspect’s S.U.V. during an attempted arrest, but not two other agents who killed the man.
abstract: Review of thousands of FBI records obtained through Freedom of Information Act request reveal that agency identified just two shootings by its agents as having been in violation of bureau policy on use of lethal force; two identified instances involved shooting of Jameel Harrison and shooting of Adrian Ricketts, which both occurred in 2014; New York Times report in 2013 had more than 150 instances of FBI agents shooting another person, dating back at least 20 years.
